comments.body:
Can this be non static? if you want to query the numEntries during the test you can use tester.state<HoverClientState>(find.byType(HoverClient))
and then you don't need to worry about previously test effect the current test.
This file is entirely moved from `listener_test.dart` and only serves as compatibility check. I'll not change this file. I'll take a look at the one in `mouse_region_test.dart`.

When you say:

> There must be a pump right after adding the pointer, which makes the MouseRegion repaint and add the annotation layer.

Does this mean that this PR changes the timing of the annotation layer addition?  What happens if you don't change the order of pumps and gestures in these tests: do they now fail after this PR, or were they just incorrectly succeeding?

If I don't change it, the tests will now fail. But that will not happen in a real application, because a `RenderMouseRegion` that has any callbacks always triggers a rerender when the first mouse is connected.
OK, as long as it can't change the application behavior.
